intro: Pharmacum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth pharmacum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. While not widely cultivated for food, it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
